item.title: Victims of AI deepfakes could sue for emotional damages under new bill
item.description: Australians who share AI deepfakes of another person without consent could be sued or fined under a new bill.

item.title: CFS firefighter Peter Curtis dies at scene of Eyre Peninsula blaze
item.description: Emergency authorities are paying tribute to Country Fire Service firefighter Peter Curtis, who died in the line of duty at a conservation park on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

item.title: History of market gardens in Kalgoorlie
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: High-level trade talks between EU and US could have knock-on effects for Australia
item.description: The European Union will ask the United States to establish a "steel union" of higher tariffs and tighter import restrictions — which could have knock-on effects in Australia's steel sector — at crucial talks in Brussels on Monday.

item.title: SA Police to restart search for 4yo Gus, six mine shafts to be searched
item.description: SA Police says it will restart its search for four-year-old Gus, who went missing in the state's Mid North almost two months ago.

item.title: Pat Cummins closes in on second Ashes Test berth, Josh Hazlewood to return 'at some point' in series
item.description: Australia coach Andrew McDonald provides an update on sidelined quicks Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood ahead of the second Ashes Test at the Gabba.

item.title: Half tonne of cocaine retrieved from WA waters off Lancelin, as livestock vessel chief charged
item.description: Police charge the chief officer of an international livestock carrier and three others, after half a tonne of cocaine was found floating off Western Australia's coast.

item.title: Australian Michelin star chef Skye Gyngell dies aged 62
item.description: Skye Gyngell was born in Sydney into a prominent broadcast family but made her mark globally as a "culinary visionary who influenced generations of chefs".

item.title: ElecraNet to explore alternative options for Northern Transmission Project after farmers voice concerns
item.description: ElectraNet are shifting their focus east, after farmers voiced concerns about renewable energy line Northern Transmission Project running through prime cropping country.

item.title: Sister of accused killer Rajwinder Singh gives evidence in Toyah Cordingley murder trial
item.description: The sister of the man accused of murdering Cairns woman Toyah Cordingley has told a court she has spoken to her brother "two or three times a week" since his extradition from India.

item.title: Spirit of Tasmania chair says auditor-general insolvency argument is 'absurd'
item.description: The auditor-general who said Tasmania's ferry operator was operating while insolvent, has been told his comments were "causing real harm to the company and its stakeholders".

item.title: Former British PM David Cameron says he has been treated for prostate cancer
item.description: A biopsy showed he had prostate cancer, to which the former British prime minister said, "You always dread hearing those words."

item.title: How last year's AFLW grand final loss made the Brisbane Lions rethink everything
item.description: Brisbane returns to the AFLW grand final with a new game plan to tackle the unbeaten, reigning premiers.

item.title: The Trump presidency could be a priceless gift to Australia
item.description: Trump cares little for alliances. So his presidency could well offer a priceless gift to Australia: a rare moment when national self-interest can eclipse sentiment.

item.title: Here's what the law says about working these holidays
item.description: Whether you're an employee counting down the days until your break, or an employer trying to keep a business open over Christmas — what are the rules about working these holidays?

item.title: Port Pirie clean-up efforts continue after thunderstorms slams SA town
item.description: Port Pirie residents and businesses are picking up the pieces after record-breaking thunderstorms hit town over the weekend.

item.title: Radio Sydney presenter Chris Bath to depart Drive show in line-up change
item.description: The presenter will move to the NSW Weekend Mornings on Sundays, while NewsRadio's Thomas Oriti will step into the Drive hosting chair.

item.title: In pictures: Berlin metro turns into urban warfare training ground
item.description: As European security threats grow, German soldiers carry out drills in metro stations to prepare for urban warfare.

item.title: NZ has halted access to puberty blockers. What does the rest of the world do?
item.description: New Zealand has become the latest country to halt access to puberty blockers for young people with gender dysphoria but are they following best health practice or an outlier?

item.title: Giant hail hits parts of south-east Queensland as heavy rain and destructive winds move north
item.description: Lightning, destructive winds and hail have hit large parts of the state, with more than 150,000 homes losing power.

item.title: Victoria's financial future and 'reliance on debt' detailed in auditor-general report
item.description: A report found Victoria recorded an operating loss of $2.6 billion in 2024-25, adding to accumulated losses of $50.6 billion over the last 6 years.

item.title: NT Health calling for new facility as ageing Royal Darwin Hospital recovers from TC Fina
item.description: The Northern Territory's largest hospital is "literally creaking at the seams" after Tropical Cyclone Fina, prompting NT Health to call for more federal funding.

item.title: Footage of deadly Sea World helicoper collision plays in court as inquest into 2023 crash begins
item.description: First responders have recounted the "absolute chaos" after two Sea World helicopters crashed in 2023, killing four people.

item.title: Brazil's ex-president Jair Bolsonaro says 'hallucinations' made him tamper with ankle monitor
item.description: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro says medication he takes for hiccups made him so paranoid that he used a soldering iron to tamper with his court-mandated ankle monitor while under house arrest.

item.title: Severe thunderstorms and hail damage crops in WA's South West and Great Southern
item.description: Farmers in southern WA say crops have been destroyed by hail and trees "snapped like matchsticks" during weekend thunderstorms.

item.title: Donald Glover reveals he had a stroke last year which forced him to cancel his New World tour
item.description: Despite a "really bad pain" in his head, Donald Glover performed a full show before heading to the hospital where he was diagnosed with a stroke.

item.title: Min Woo Lee hails 'career best' mindset ahead of Australian PGA Championship
item.description: Min Woo Lee learned valuable lessons from the way he handled the first US PGA Tour win of his career, which are set to put him in a strong position to fire at the Australian PGA Championship.

item.title: Senate shut down for 1.5 hours after Pauline Hanson's burka stunt
item.description: The rare break in proceedings came after One Nation's Pauline Hanson strode into the chamber wearing a burka and then refused to leave after being slapped with a sanction.

item.title: Teenage boy dies in stabbing at reserve near schools in Sydney's Rouse Hill
item.description: NSW Police said two young boys were at a reserve at Rouse Hill when they were approached by three other boys about 4:20pm on Monday.

item.title: Disturbance at Banksia Hill Detention Centre, children on roof
item.description: A number of detainees have climbed onto the roof of Perth's youth detention centre, damaging sheeting and throwing projectiles.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Australia no guarantee to pick Usman Khawaja for second Ashes Test at Gabba
item.description: Australia coach Andrew McDonald has failed to guarantee Usman Khawaja will be selected for the second Ashes Test, even if the under-pressure veteran opener is fit.

item.title: Bureau of Meteorology boss reveals website rebuild 'approved and funded' by Turnbull government
item.description: The Bureau of the Meteorology's new chief executive has blamed a "miscommunication" for the furore that has erupted over a costly and controversial website redesign.

item.title: Nikhil Chaudhary becomes first Indian to score Sheffield Shield century in the 2000s
item.description: Nikhil Chaudhary has become the first Indian to hit a Sheffield Shield hundred this century, helping put Tasmania in a position of utter dominance against NSW.

item.title: What is really in a vape?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Bollywood superstar Dharmendra dies in Mumbai, aged 89
item.description: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi is one of many to pay tribute to the icon of Indian cinema.

item.title: Jimmy Cliff, reggae music pioneer, dies at 81
item.description: Cliff was known for singles You Can Get It If You Really Want It and Many Rivers To Cross, as well as for his cover of Johnny Nash's I Can See Clearly Now.

item.title: Cotality Housing Affordability Report shows 'extraordinary rise' in home values
item.description: Home prices have risen by almost 50 per cent in the past five years, with more than a decade now needed to save for a standard 20 per cent deposit for a house in most capital cities, according to a new report.

item.title: 'AI slop' crowned word of the year 2025 in Macquarie Dictionary's committee and people's choice categories
item.description: 'AI slop' refers to low-quality content created by generative AI which often contains errors and is not requested by the user, according to Macquarie.

item.title: Kangaroos star Ash Riddell wins AFLW best and fairest award
item.description: Runner-up to Adelaide's Ebony Marinoff last year, Riddell polled 23 votes to add the league's highest individual honour to her fifth All-Australian selection.

item.title: Kim Nok-wan sentenced to life in prison for sexual abuse and exploitation of hundreds of people in South Korea
item.description: A court in Seoul ruled that Kim Nok-wan's crimes were so grave they warranted his "permanent isolation from society."

item.title: US and Ukraine work on 'refined' plan to end war after European pushback
item.description: The US blindsided Kyiv and European countries with a 28-point peace plan last week, giving Ukraine until Thursday to agree to a framework to end Europe's deadliest war since World War Two.

item.title: US labels Maduro-tied Cartel de los Soles a terror organisation
item.description: The designation is the latest measure in the Trump administration's escalating campaign to combat drug trafficking into the US.

item.title: Woman found alive in her coffin at crematorium in Thailand
item.description: Temple staff in Thailand were shocked when the woman began knocking from the coffin.

item.title: Xi Jinping tells Donald Trump Taiwan's 'return to China' is key to international post-war order
item.description: Chinese state media reported some of what was discussed in the phone call that took place on Monday, local time.

item.title: Mt Atkinson town centre delay sparks calls for council to skip public consultation
item.description: Locals are frustrated by hold-ups with a long awaited shopping strip in Mt Atkinson, in Melbourne's major growth corridor in the west.

item.title: Gaza Humanitarian Foundation closes as ceasefire holds
item.description: More than 800 Palestinians died in the vicinity of Gaza Humanitarian Foundation aid sites after it took over the distribution of all supplies in the strip in May.

item.title: Shooters, Fishers, Farmers party row as key figures quit over Carlo Di Falco's Hobart stadium backflip
item.description: Key figures in Tasmania's Shooters, Fishers and Farmers Party have quit following new MP Carlo Di Falco's backflip on the Macquarie Point Stadium project.

item.title: ABC 50-50 quiz: Every question is an even chance
item.description: Every question has only two options, one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

item.title: Australia's first female supreme court chief justice has never thought of herself as a trailblazer
item.description: Marilyn Warren made history when she was appointed chief justice of the Supreme Court of Victoria, though she has never thought of herself as a trailblazer.

item.title: Court dismisses criminal cases against Donald Trump critics James Comey and Letitia James
item.description: Former FBI director James Comey and New York Attorney-General Letitia James had been charged shortly after Donald Trump used social media to instruct his attorney-general to take action against them.

item.title: Gambling ad ban would pass parliament with a conscience vote, Labor MP says
item.description: Macarthur MP Mike Freelander believes the multi-partisan support for restricting gambling advertising means the reforms will "get there" eventually.

item.title: Terminally ill man allegedly abused as a child at Ashley detention centre fights to access records
item.description: The family of a dying man asked for his records from Tasmania's notorious prison for children, Ashley. They were told it could take eight months — time he does not have.

item.title: Bitcoin crash unsettles financial markets, with 'contagion' fears surfacing
item.description: It's been a wild ride for bitcoin traders in recent months and, after a weekend of crypto and blockchain enthusiasm at a Sydney convention, sceptics continue to flag the risks.

item.title: The wind is picking up in Kalumburu
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Cyclone Fina crosses West Australian coast as category three system
item.description: Cyclone Fina has hit the coastline of far northern Western Australia as a category three system.

item.title: Emergency department wait times for mental health patients stretching over 23 hours, report finds
item.description: New data shows some patients with serious mental health conditions have been waiting more than 23 hours for a bed in emergency departments.

item.title: Why APRA wants to slowly deflate the property bubble
item.description: Amid global warnings of impending financial doom, APRA and the Reserve Bank are far more concerned about a home-grown bubble, one that's been taking in oxygen for almost three decades.

item.title: The 28-point peace plan for Ukraine mostly contains the same points previously made by Moscow
item.description: A detailed look at the 28-point plan — as it has been reported — shows some very minor concessions to Russia. But it mostly contains all the same points that have always been made with more or less force by Moscow.

item.title: Gus search to extend to mine shafts as police vow to 'explore every avenue'
item.description: In their effort to find missing four-year-old Gus, police have vowed "explore every avenue" — which now includes several mine shafts around the property where he disappeared.

item.title: Marufa Akter is inspiring Bangladeshi girls in a 'revolution' for women's cricket
item.description: From ploughing rice fields during COVID, Marufa Akter’s remarkable rise to Bangladesh cricket star has inspired a generation of girls to take up cricket.

item.title: Andor and Death by Lightning costumer designer Michael Wilkinson creates worlds with fabric
item.description: Michael Wilkinson won an Emmy for his intricate costumes in the celebrated Star Wars series Andor. Now, he is recreating 1880s America for Death By Lightning.

item.title: Slain officer's friends don't want to hear Porepunkah gunman Dezi Freeman's name
item.description: While Porepunkah residents are trying to move on from the tragic deaths of two police officers, there is one person they are eager to forget.
